cc:Work.dc:description: Description of the GNOME clock applet's key features.

flowRoot.flowPara: The clock in Ubuntu does more than tell the time.

It integrates seamlessly with Evolution to keep track of information and remind you of upcoming events or important tasks. For communicating across time zones, unfold the Locations section to find out exactly what time it is and even what the weather is like anywhere around the globe.
FIXME: Description of world clock does not accommodate extra-terrestrials and currently is not entirely accurate in saying "anywhere" -- hopefully the relevant bug will be fixed by Jackalope, though
FIXME: Times are totally inconsistent and screenshots are ugly for some reason. Looks like we need some screenshot-taking rocket scientists!
